cheatsheet.title: Create a Vestigo connection profile and query

intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you how to create a JPA connection profile and how to create and execute a simple JPA query

item.title: Open the Vestigo perspective
item.description: If the perspective is not already open open the perspective. Select in the main menu Window > Show Perspective > Other... > Vestigo or click on the link below.

item.title: Download demo project
item.description:
You can download a demo project with simple JDO and JPA data-models. Open the browser to download the demo project. to quickly get started using Vestigo. The demo project is provided as zip file whose contents should be extracted to some directory on your hard drive you can easily relocate.
The location of the demo project is: http://vestigo.nightlabs.com/${project.version}/download/demo/org.nightlabs.vestigo.demo-${project.version}-bin.zip
The next step will open the Eclipse internal browser to download the zip. The following will close the browser. You can of course skip these steps and download the file using an other method.

subitem.label: Open the browser to download the demo project.
Close the browser that was used to download the demo project.

item.title: Start the Connection Profile Wizard
item.description: Select the Data Source Explorer view and right-click on the JPA Connections entry in the tree of connection types. Invoke the New... action from the context menu.

item.title: Define a connection name
item.description: Enter a name for the connection. Use for example Demo JPA connection. When finished click the Next button of the wizard.

item.title: Define the classpath for the connection
item.description:
In the next step you must define the classpath for the conneciton. The classpath of your connection must include your datamodel, the JPA implementation and the JDBC drivers to access the database. For the demo project all is provided in the projects zip-file as separate jars.
Use the first action of the wizard page to Add one or more files (EAR, JAR, WAR etc.). In the dialog that opens browse to the directory you've extracted the demo project to and select all jar-files, then click OK.
Note, that Vestigo also allows to add all contents of an archive (zip, war, ear etc.) or folder recursively. However for this tutorial we will use the separate jars.
When you've added all jars of the demo project click the Next button.

item.title: Choose the persistence unit
item.description: When the Persistence unit page opens it automatically searches for persistence units in your classpath. For the demo project it will find two persistence units, please use the one for JPA: vestigoDemoMovieJPA. Select the persistence unit from the table and click Next.

item.title: Check and override persistence properties
item.description:
The next page will initially show you all properties from the persistence unit you have selected. Note that these entries are displayed in light gray indicating that they are inherited from the persistence unit. For this demo you need to override one entry, the connection url defining the coordinates to the derby database containing the demo data.
Change the entry with the key javax.persistence.jdbc.url to match the path of the folder you've extracted the demo project to. For example on Linux the the new value might look like this jdbc:derby:/home/myuser/tmp/vestigo-demo/derby/vestigoDemoMovieJPA. On Windows the Entry might look something like the following: jdbc:derby:C:\Users\myuser\Desktop\vestigo-demo\derby\vestigoDemoMovieJPA
Note that after changing the value the entry will be automatically checked and displayed with a fat font indicating that you have overwritten the value from the persistence unit.
When you're done changing the value click the Test Connection button in order to check your settings. If the ping succeeds you can Finish the dialog. You've just created your first Vestigo JPA connection profile.

item.title: Connect the profile
item.description: After you've created the connection profile you can connect it. Select the new connection in the Data Source Explorer view, right-click and select Connect.

item.title: Show the candidate classes
item.description: After the connection has been established the Candidate classes view will load all classes that are possible candidates for a query. Bring the view to the foreground in order to see the list of candidate classes.

item.title: Create simple query for a candidate class
item.description: In order to create a simple query selecting all instances of a class you only have to double-click the class in the Candidate classes view. Choose the org.nightlbs.vestigo.demo.jpa.Movie class and double-click. This will create a new query editor already including the select statement.

item.title: Execute the query
item.description:
To execute the query use the Execute Button ([Ctrl + F5]) or double-click once again on the In order to create a simple query selecting all instances of a class you only have to double-click the class in the Candidate classes view. This will create a new query editor already including the select statement.
The query is executed and you can now browse the results in the Result Sets and Object Graph Detail Tree views.
